content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table, with 7 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “t, in seconds.” The heading for row 2 is “y of t, in feet.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. t is 0. y of t is 0. Column 2. t is 100. y of t is 50. Column 3. t is 200. y of t is 400. Column 4. t is 300. y of t is 1360. Column 5. t is 400. y of t is 3200. Column 6. t is 500. y of t is 6250. Column 7. t is 600. y of t is 10950." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="7em 0.05em 4em 4em 4em 4em 4em 4em 4em" equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>t</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.45em"></mspace><mtext>(seconds)</mtext></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>100</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>200</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>300</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>400</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>500</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>600</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.45em"></mspace><mtext>(feet)</mtext></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>50</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>400</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1360</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3200</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6250</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>10</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>950</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: A rocket leaves the surface of Earth at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> and travels straight up from the surface. The height, in feet, of the rocket above the surface of Earth is given by <math alttext="y of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is measured in seconds for <math alttext="0 less than or equal to t, less than or equal to 600" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>600</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Values of <math alttext="y of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> for selected values of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> are given in the table above. Of the following values of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, at which value would the speed of the rocket most likely be greatest based on the data in the table?

topic.text: 1.1: Introducing Calculus - Can Change Occur at an Instant?

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
